thing-type.label: GE/Jasco 14321 In-Wall Dimmer
thing-type.description: In-Wall Dimmer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<strong&gtBasic operation </strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtNote: Before starting, fan must be set to ‘HIGH’ position using pull chain. The connected fan can then be turned ON/OFF and adjust speed levels in two ways:</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtManually from the front panel rocker of the In-Wall Fan Control.</li&gt <li&gtRemotely with a Z-Wave controller.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gt<strong&gtManual control</strong&gt</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtTo turn the connected fan ON: Press and release the top of the rocker. NOTE: Fan will return to last speed setting of Fan Control. Default setting – HIGH.</li&gt <li&gtTo turn the fan OFF: Press and release the bottom of the rocker.</li&gt </ol&gt<p&gt<strong&gtAdjust fan speed </strong&gt</p&gt <p&gtThe LED indicator confirms fan speed settings by flashing patterns LOW – LED will blink every 2 seconds for 10 seconds MEDIUM – LED will blink every second for 10 seconds HIGH – LED will blink every half second for 10 seconds</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtTo decrease fan speed: Press and hold lower rocker.</li&gt <li&gtTo increase fan speed: Press and hold upper rocker. </li&gt </ol&gt<p&gt<strong&gtThis device supports Association Command Class (3 Groups) </strong&gt</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtAssociation Group 1 supports Lifeline, Switch Multilevel Report</li&gt <li&gtAssociation Group 2 supports Basic Set and is controlled by pressing the On or Off button with the local load</li&gt <li&gtAssociation Group 3 supports Basic Set and is controlled by double pressing the On or Off button</li&gt <li&gtEach Association Group supports 5 total nodes</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtOnce the controller is ready to add your device, press and release the top or bottom of the smart fan control switch (rocker) to add it in the network.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtOnce the controller is ready to remove your device, press and release the top or bottom of the wireless smart switch (rocker) to remove it from the network.</p&gt

parameter.label: 3: Night Light
parameter.description: Defines the behavior of the blue LED<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis configuration parameter defines the behavior of the blue LED "night light".</p&gt <p&gtThe default behavior is "ON_WHEN_OFF" - the LED is on when the switch is set to off.</p&gt <p&gtThe other two options are "ON_WHEN_ON" - the LED is on when the switch is set to on, and</p&gt <p&gt"ALWAYS_OFF" - the LED is always off.</p&gt</p&gt
